multiple.question: What is the most significant difference between the "short run" and "long run" in macroeconomics?

answers.answer: In the long run, all of the factors of production can change.
In the short run, all of the factors of production can change.
In the long run, wages are fully flexible, meaning increases in spending will only cause inflation.
In the short run, wages are fully flexible, meaning increases in spending will only cause inflation.
In the short run, only the labor factor can be changed.
